activities.loc: Br 10 - Law Enforcement Center - West Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashley C Gandy Jr

Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:58 AM Defendant Ashley C Gandy Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Tom Hayes in court for Ashley C Gandy Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. 
BTC: $10/Month commencing in 90 days for court appointed attorney.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court reappoints Attorney Tom Hayes to these reissued cases.
for defendant for Preliminary Hearing on 9/28/22, at 9 AM (emailed to RCSO @ 8:52 AM, on 9/20/22)

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim J.P.J (person, property, residence or family).

1:50 PM Defendant Ashley C Gandy Jr appeared by video, in custody in Dodge.  Attorney Alexia S Gianitsos appeared by video for Ashley C Gandy Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjourned initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
